title: Stare Decisis and Randall v Sorrell

content.description: In the case Randall v. Sorrell (2006), Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer argued that following judicial precedent “avoids the instability and unfairness that accompany disruption of settled legal expectations. For this reason, the rule of law demands that adhering to our prior case law be the norm. Departure from precedent is exceptional and requires special justification.”
content.question: Justice Breyer is referring to which of the following legal principles?
